metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11503 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
snap-confine as included in snapd before 2.39 did not guard against symlink races when performing the chdir() to the current working directory of the calling user, aka a "cwd restore permission bypass."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11503` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.39.2+18.04
snapd - 2.39.2+18.04
snapd-xdg-open - 2.39.2+18.04
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.39.2+18.04
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.39.2+18.04
ubuntu-snappy - 2.39.2+18.04
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.39.2+18.04
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> fixed via SRU process (security only users get the fix due to reexec) attack limited by snap-confine profile

criterions.comment: snapd package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.39.2+18.04').
